column4: On partait pas aux Beaux-Arts ensemble, puis-que moi je travailler à l'époque à la route de Saint-Gilles, mais souvent on revenait. On revenait dans la nuit après le cours. Si c'était un four. On pouvait revenir à 2 ou 3 h du matin, on se raccompagner, on a discuté.
column7: We didn't go to the Beaux-Arts together, because I was working at the time on the Route de Saint-Gilles, but we often came back. We came back at night after the course. If it was a flop. We could come back at 2 or 3 in the morning, we walked each other home, we talked.

column4: On discutait et puis souvent on s'arrêtait...
column7: We were talking and then we often stopped...

column4: Pour manger des cheeses. Ça s'appeller... Nîmes
column7: To eat cheeseburgers.  It was called Nîmes...

column4: Nîmes Burger, quoi.  Y'avait pas encore MacDonald's.
column7: Nîmes Burger, then. There wasn't McDonald's yet.

column4: C'était les tout premiers, alors c'était loin, loin de Maconald's.
column7: They were the very first ones, so it was a long, long way from Maconald's.
